fact_check_explanation_summary: There’s plenty of evidence that the bombs dropped on Hiroshima and Nagasaki were not napalm, as a Facebook post claims.

fact_check_explanation_title: £24bn in extra defence spending will be spread over four years
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Institute for Fiscal Studies has previously described the practice of adding up multiple years of spending increases as “misleading”.

fact_check_explanation_title: Boris Johnson’s claims on UK accepting people fleeing conflict miss vital context
fact_check_explanation_summary: The UK has resettled more people than other European countries through resettlement schemes, but that doesn’t include hundreds of thousands of people also seeking asylum.

fact_check_explanation_title: Sign telling Russian troops ‘go f*** yourselves’ was Photoshopped
fact_check_explanation_summary: The picture, which went viral online, was designed by the Ukrainian authorities to encourage people to tear down road signs.

fact_check_explanation_title: Photo of wounded Ukrainian woman near Kharkiv is genuine
fact_check_explanation_summary: Posts on Facebook claim that photographs of a Ukrainian woman injured after an airstrike near Kharkiv actually depict events from 2018. This isn’t the case, and the images are genuine.

fact_check_explanation_title: Video of explosion aftermath is from Lebanon in 2020, not Ukraine
fact_check_explanation_summary: A video shared on social media claims to show an explosion and collapsed buildings in Ukraine, but it actually shows an explosion in Lebanon in 2020.

fact_check_explanation_title: Lightning strike video doesn’t show war in Ukraine
fact_check_explanation_summary: The video appeared online almost a month before the Russian invasion.

fact_check_explanation_title: Video shows game footage, not a plane being shot at in Ukraine
fact_check_explanation_summary: The developers of Arma 3 confirmed that the footage came from a modified version of their game.

fact_check_explanation_title: Map of Russian nuclear targets in UK dates back to the Cold War
fact_check_explanation_summary: A map being shared on social media suggests potential sites of Russian nuclear strikes across the UK, but the original estimates are now 50 years old, and don't give any …

fact_check_explanation_title: Pornhub isn’t blocked in Russia following the invasion of Ukraine
fact_check_explanation_summary: This is a rumour that may have begun on Twitter. The site appears to be working normally for users in Russia.

fact_check_explanation_title: Beirut port explosion footage being mistaken as Ukraine
fact_check_explanation_summary: Video apparently taken from a street in Beirut of the 2020 explosion is being shared as though it was filmed in Ukraine.

fact_check_explanation_title: Collection of heart attack articles includes one fake
fact_check_explanation_summary: A list of things that can cause heart attacks “in 2022” includes one fake article and another from 2010.
